I think this question is about CloudOps. What are the benefits of the cloud regardless of the solution being put in it? Redundancy and managed authentication...IMHO. https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/routers/sdwan/knowledge-base/CloudOps/b-cisco-sdwan-cloudops/m-cloudops-overview.html

The data plane is composed by the vEdge (Branch, Head Offices, DC, etc) the data plane CANNOT be centralized. A is not correct.
B,C are correct.
B AND C

it cant be A since cisco sdwan has a distributed arhitecture. control = vsmart, data = vedge.
i think is b and c

BC... Book "Cisco SDWAN Defined Wide Area Networks"
by Jason, Dana, Dustin, and JOhn
B and C IaaS is in question 19. Which two platforms for the Cisco SD-WAN architecture are deployable in a hypervisor on-premises or in IAAS Cloud?
agree with B and C

advantages of deploying cloud-based Cisco SD-WAN controllers?
the question is about CONTROLLERS, I think A itÂ´s not correct.
I'd say it's not A, B and E.... but I dont know if I agree with C and D.... this is a weird question.

I think it is not B IaaS since Cisco is deploying and managing all the controllers VMs over AWS/Azure, so it is consumed in the way of SaaS in fact. But I disagree also with A, given that it does not matter where the controllers are place (cloud or on-prem), the functionality and centralized control is just the same.

comments.content: When you deploy your controllers in a cloud, it can be IaaS where the cloud provider gives you only the infrastructure and you need to build up your virtual hardware and software and you maintain both. That is IaaS if i'm not wrong. But the question in this form is still weird because how IaaS is an advantage of doing IaaS? Altough B is a better option than A for sure.

questions.question_text: An engineer creates a data policy to prevent communication from the 172.20.21.0/24 network to the 172.20.41.0/24 network. Which configuration accomplishes this task?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Option A doesn't have prefix. Without defining prefix, where will you send the traffic? I understand SLA class must match MPLS (color) for video traffic but option A doesn't have a meaning without prefix.

Honestly, I find the cisco SDWAN has not matured yet.
So many contradictive views on every other question.... this is not a coincidence. 
GUI menu, wording, procedures, hierarchy, clarity.. All this needs to be pilled and pilled yet more...

Selected Answer: A
A is correct. There is a new type of list used specifically for App-Route policies, called an SLA Class, Network administrators use an SLA Class list to define the maximum permitted
latency, loss, and jitter.
Two fields have been configured in this action: SLA Class and the Preferred
Color.
The Preferred Color field contains
the color or colors that the network administrator desires to forward this application
class across, as long as those colors are in compliance with the SLA class.
specify the VPN or VPNs that the policy is to be applied

Selected Answer: D
D is Correct

Selected Answer: A
A correct
MPLS is a color, so A

questions.question_text: What is the function of colocation in Cloud OnRamp SaaS?

discussion.content: B correct Answer

Selected Answer: B
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/routers/sdwan-cloud-onramp-for-colocation/solution-user-guide/cisco-sdwan-cloud-onramp-colocation-solution-guide-20-4/about-cisco-sd-wan-Cloud-OnRamp-for-Colocation-solution.html

choices.D: The Cloud OnRamp for colocation solution restricts the creation of different VNF service chains orchestrated in Cisco vManage and deployed on a cluster in a colocation facility.
choices.A: In Cloud OnRamp, colocation supports the capability of virtualizing access-only locations and using colocation centers that require the customer to extend to the cloud.
choices.C: With colocation facility in Cloud OnRamp, the customer faces challenges to virtualize the security and optimization infrastructure that influence traffic through network elements.
choices.B: Cloud OnRamp incorporates regional colocation facilities by choosing between cloud access points at the remote site and regional cloud access points at the colocation facilities.
